#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk crash
exit 0

Vulnerability.Title: crash bug fix and enhancement update
Vulnerability.Description: The crash packages provide a self-contained tool that can be used to investigate live systems and kernel core dumps created from the netdump, diskdump, kdump, and Xen/KVM "virsh dump" facilities from Red Hat Enterprise Linux. The crash packages have been upgraded to upstream version 7.0.9, which provides a number of bug fixes and enhancements over the previous version. (BZ#1110513) This update also fixes the following bugs: Previously, a regression caused significant performance loss in the "ps" subcommand of the crash utility. As a consequence, under certain circumstances, it could take extremely long for "ps" to execute after a kernel panic. With this update, the underlying code has been fixed to address the performance of "ps", and executing the command now takes an appropriate amount of time. (BZ#1134177) Prior to this update, the crash packages did not build on the little-endian variant of IBM Power Systems. Consequently, users of this platform did not have crash available, which prevented other programs from working. With this update, crash has been updated to support the little-endian variant of IBM Power Systems, and the users now have working crash packages. (BZ#1123991) Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7 kernels have removed their STACKFAULT exception stacks. As a consequence, the "bt" command displayed an invalid exception stack location in backtrace errors that transition from an exception stack to a process kernel stack. An upstream patch has been applied to fix this bug, and the "bt" command now works as intended. (BZ#1179476) Previously, the "bt" command failed to generate backtraces of the active tasks when run on the little-endian variant of IBM Power Systems compressed kdump dumpfiles. An upstream patch has been applied to fix this bug, and the "bt" command now works as intended. (BZ#1184401) Users of crash are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which fix these bugs and add these enhancements. Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
